report.report_text:
[Report de-identified (Safe-harbor compliant) by De-ID v.6.22.07.0]
**INSTITUTION GENERAL MEDICINE HISTORY AND PHYSICAL EXAMINATION
PATIENT NAME: **NAME[AAA, BBB M] ACCOUNT #: **ID-NUM **ROOM ATTENDING PHYSICIAN: **NAME[YYY] **NAME[ZZZ] ADMISSION DATE: **DATE[Oct 22 2007]
DATE OF SERVICE: **DATE[Oct 23 2007]
This is a history and physical for attending, please see Dr. **NAME[XXX]'s note for detail of the patient's presentation and plan. I agree with plan outlined in his note and the case was discussed with him. I have personally seen and examined the patient.
HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS:
In brief, this a **AGE[in teens]-year-old woman who was admitted with DKA. **NAME[BBB], unfortunately, has had four to five episodes of DKA over the last year secondary to medication noncompliance and some social issues going on in her house. Over the last three or four days, she has had a viral illness and been not consistent about taking her medications. This was also complicated by some conflict with her parents and she left or was either kicked out of her house the day of her admission. She was complaining of some abdominal pain and some runny nose and cough, but otherwise denies fevers, chills, diarrhea, chest pain, palpitations, lightheadedness, syncope, or presyncope.
PAST MEDICAL/SURGICAL HISTORY:
Her past medical history is notable for type 1 diabetes, asthma, and in **DATE[Jun] of 2006 she had an MVA leading to an L1 compression fracture.
ALLERGIES:
SHE IS ALLERGIC TO PENICILLIN AND AMOXICILLIN.
MEDICATIONS:
Her medications on presentation are Lantus 66 units at bedtime and NovoLog 30 units with each meal, and Ultram, though her compliance with these is a little unclear.
SOCIAL HISTORY:
She just moved into a friend's place where she is being allowed to occupy a room. She is not paying rent. She works as clerical work. She denies any smoking, drinking, or alcohol use. She is sexually active with a boyfriend and she has had several sexual partners in the last year. She says she is generally good about using protection.
FAMILY HISTORY:
The family history is notable for hypertension and thyroid disease.
REVIEW OF SYSTEMS:
Her review of systems was otherwise negative except for the viral symptoms of runny nose and cough that I noted above.
PHYSICAL EXAMINATION:
Her vital signs on my examination were blood pressure was 126/70, heart rate was around 120, respirations were 20, she was afebrile, and she was sating 100% on room air. She was a tired-appearing young woman in no acute distress, occasionally sniffling her nose. Her oropharynx was clear. She had no sinus tenderness. She had no nuchal rigidity. Lungs were clear to auscultation. No wheeze was appreciated. She was tachy, no murmurs were noted. Her abdomen was soft. She had no hepatosplenomegaly and no pain. Her extremities were warm and well perfused. She had no obvious rash. Her strength was grossly intact.
LABORATORY RESULTS:
Her most recent laboratory work from 1:30 on **DATE[Oct 23 2007] showed an anion gap of 7 with a bicarb of 21. Her latest glucoses were 191, 193, and 292. Her CBC was within normal limits except for a low neutrophil count, but high bands of 8.
ASSESSMENT AND PLAN:
This is a **AGE[in teens]-year-old young woman admitted for DKA secondary to noncompliance and a recent viral illness complicated by a difficult social situation.
1. Her DKA. She has been transitioned from an insulin drip to her first dose of Lantus this afternoon. We will stop her D5 half normal saline solution and simply follow her sugars closely through the course of the day and also follow her laboratory studies to ensure that her gap does not return and her glucoses are reasonably well controlled.
2. She has had some new sexual partners. There has been some concern about her protection. This was discussed with her and we will proceed with some STD testing just to make sure. She did have a urine pregnancy test in the ED that was negative.
3. The most significant issue with **NAME[BBB] obviously is her social situation amd how to prevent another one of these episodes of DKA. We have had Social Work and Medical Assistance come and see if she can apply for and receive Medicaid in an effort to help her with compliance with her medications. Will also work with the social worker in the **INSTITUTION to see what other support we can provide **NAME[BBB] as she makes this transition from her home to this new living situation. It has obviously been stressed to **NAME[BBB] that continued noncompliance will lead to DKA which she is well aware.
___________________________________ **NAME[YYY] **NAME[ZZZ]
Dictator: **NAME[YYY ZZZ], M.D.
AM/klf
D: **DATE[Oct 23 2007] 15:23:06 T: **DATE[Oct 23 2007] 21:08:25 R: **DATE[Oct 23 2007] 21:08:25/klf
